types.name: Job
types.description: A job corresponds to some long running task that the client should poll for status.

fields.name: done
fields.description: This indicates if the job is still queued or has been run.

fields.name: query
fields.description: This field will only resolve once the job is done. Can be used to ask for object(s) that have been changed by the job.

types.name: ID
types.description:
Represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache.
The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String, but it is not intended to be human-readable.
When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.

Admin API example value: `"gid://shopify/Product/10079785100"`.

Storefront API example value: `"Z2lkOi8vc2hvcGlmeS9Qcm9kdWN0LzEwMDc5Nzg1MTAw"`.

types.name: Node
types.description: An object with an ID to support global identification.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

types.name: Order
types.description: An order represents an agreement to do business between a customer and a merchant.

fields.name: alerts
fields.description:
Generated messages that appear at the top of an order page in the Shopify admin.
For example, _this is a test order_.

fields.name: billingAddress
fields.description:
Mailing address provided by the customer.
Not all orders have mailing addresses.

fields.name: billingAddressMatchesShippingAddress
fields.description: Whether the billing address matches the shipping address.

fields.name: calculatedExchange
fields.description: Calculate the exchange to be processed.

args.name: input
args.description: The input params for calculating an exchange.

fields.name: canMarkAsPaid
fields.description: Whether the order can be manually marked as paid.

fields.name: canNotifyCustomer
fields.description: Whether notifications can be sent to the customer or not.

fields.name: cancelReason
fields.description:
Reason the order was canceled.
Returns null if the order wasn't canceled.

fields.name: cancelledAt
fields.description:
Date and time when the order was canceled.
Returns null if the order wasn't canceled.

fields.name: capturable
fields.description:
Whether payment for the order can be captured.
Returns true when the customer's credit card has been authorized for payment and the authorization period has not expired.

fields.name: cartDiscountAmount
fields.description: Amount of the order-level discount (does not contain any line item discounts).

fields.name: cartDiscountAmountSet
fields.description: Amount of the order-level discount (does not contain any line item discounts) in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: Channel that created the order.

fields.name: clientIp
fields.description: The ip address of the client that is associated with this order.

fields.name: closed
fields.description: Whether the order is closed.

fields.name: closedAt
fields.description:
Date and time when the order closed.
If the order is not closed, then this field is null.

fields.name: confirmed
fields.description: Whether inventory has been reserved for the order.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date and time when the order was created in Shopify.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description:
The currency of the store at the time of the order.
If payment hasn't occurred, then this field is null.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description:
Custom information added to the order by your customer
(Also referred to as note attributes).

fields.name: customer
fields.description:
Unique identifier of the customer who placed the order.
Not all orders have customers associated with them.

fields.name: customerAcceptsMarketing
fields.description: Whether the customer agreed to receive marketing materials.

fields.name: customerJourney
fields.description: Description of the customer's experience with the store leading up to the order.

fields.name: customerLocale
fields.description:
A two-letter or three-letter language code, optionally followed by a region modifier.
Example values could be 'en', 'en-CA', 'en-PIRATE'.

fields.name: discountApplications
fields.description: Discounts that have been applied on the order.

fields.name: multiCurrencyStatus
fields.description:
Summary of the order's multi-currency state.
Namely, returns non-null if either the payment currency differs from the shop currency or the order was converted from a payment currency at checkout.
Returns null for a single currency order.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
Unique identifier for the order that appears on the order.
For example, _#1000_ or _Store1001.
This value is not unique across multiple stores.

fields.name: netPayment
fields.description: Net payment for the order, based on the total amount received - total amount refunded.

fields.name: netPaymentSet
fields.description: Net payment for the order, based on the total amount received - total amount refunded in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: nonFulfillableLineItems
fields.description:
Line items that can't be fulfilled.
For example, because some or all of the items have been refunded, or the item is not one which can be fulfilled, such as a tip.
These line items would be 'lost' if you only considered the line items in draft fulfillments or fulfillments.

fields.name: physicalLocation

fields.name: presentmentCurrencyCode
fields.description: The payment currency of the customer for this order.

fields.name: processedAt
fields.description:
Date and time when the order was processed.
When orders are imported from an app, this date and time may not match the date and time when the order was created.

fields.name: publication
fields.description: Publication that created the order.

fields.name: receiptNumber
fields.description:
Unique identifier for a POS order that appears on the customer receipt.
For example, _12-1000_ or _98567-54_.
This value is not unique across multiple stores.

fields.name: referralCode
fields.description:
Marketing referral code from the link that the customer clicked to visit your store.
Supports the following URL attributes: _ref_, _source_, or _r_. For example, if the URL is myshopifystore.com/products/slide?ref=j2tj1tn2, then this value is j2tj1tn2.

fields.name: referrerDisplayText
fields.description: Website that sent the customer to your online store.

fields.name: referrerUrl
fields.description:
Webpage where the customer clicked a link that sent them to your online store.
For example, _Google_ or _randomblog.com/page1_.

fields.description: List of refunds that have been applied to the order.

fields.description: Line item that contains the shipping costs.

fields.name: subtotalLineItemsQuantity
fields.description: The sum of the quantities for the line items that contribute to the order's subtotal.

fields.name: subtotalPrice
fields.description: Subtotal of the line items and their discounts (does not contain shipping costs, shipping discounts, and order-level discounts).

fields.name: subtotalPriceSet
fields.description: Subtotal of the line items and their discounts (does not contain shipping costs, shipping discounts, and order-level discounts) in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: suggestedRefund
fields.description: The details of the suggested refund. This response can be used to submit a RefundCreate mutation.

args.name: shippingAmount
args.description: The amount to refund for shipping. Overrides `refundShipping`.

args.name: shippingAmountV2
args.description: The amount to refund for shipping, with currency in either the shop or presentment currency. Overrides `refundShipping`.

args.name: refundShipping
args.description: Whether to refund the full shipping amount.

args.name: refundLineItems
args.description: The line items from the order to include in the refund.

args.name: suggestFullRefund
args.description:
Whether a refund for all of the refundable line items on an order should be suggested.
If `true`, the suggested refund will be formed from all refundable line items and will
ignore any passed in `refundLineItems`.

types.name: MoneyV2
types.description:
A monetary value with currency.

To format currencies, combine this type's amount and currencyCode fields with your client's locale.

For example, in JavaScript you could use Intl.NumberFormat:

```js
new Intl.NumberFormat(locale, {
  style: 'currency',
  currency: currencyCode
}).format(amount);
```

Other formatting libraries include:

* iOS - [NumberFormatter](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/foundation/numberformatter)
* Android - [NumberFormat](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/NumberFormat.html)
* PHP - [NumberFormatter](http://php.net/manual/en/class.numberformatter.php)

For a more general solution, the [Unicode CLDR number formatting database] is available with many implementations
(such as [TwitterCldr](https://github.com/twitter/twitter-cldr-rb)).

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Decimal money amount.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: Currency of the money.

history, and whether they've agreed to receive email marketing.

fields.name: canDelete

A customer can be deleted from a store only if they have not yet made an order. After a customer makes an
order, they can't be deleted from a store.

fields.description: The date and time when the customer was added to the store.

fields.description: The default address associated with the customer.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description:
The full name of the customer, based on the values for first_name and last_name. If the first_name and
last_name are not available, then this falls back to the customer's email address, and if that is not available, the customer's phone number.

fields.name: email

customer gave when they consented to receive marketing material by email.

If the customer does not accept email marketing, then this property will be null.

guarantee that the email address actually exists.

During a search (i.e. when the `query` parameter has been specified on the connection) this sorts the
results by relevance to the search term(s). When no search query is specified, this sort key is not
deterministic and should not be used.

types.name: CustomerState
types.description: The valid values for the state of a customer's account with a shop.

enumValues.name: DECLINED
enumValues.description: The customer declined the email invite to create an account.

enumValues.name: DISABLED
enumValues.description: The customer doesn't have an active account. Customer accounts can be disabled from the Shopify admin at any time.

enumValues.name: ENABLED
enumValues.description: The customer has created an account.

enumValues.name: INVITED
enumValues.description: The customer has received an email invite to create an account.

types.name: CustomerMarketingOptInLevel
types.description:
The valid values for the marketing subscription opt-in active at the time the customer consented to email
marketing.

The levels are defined by [the M3AAWG best practices guideline
  document](https://www.m3aawg.org/sites/maawg/files/news/M3AAWG_Senders_BCP_Ver3-2015-02.pdf).

enumValues.name: SINGLE_OPT_IN
enumValues.description:
The customer started receiving marketing email(s) after providing their email address, without any
intermediate steps.

enumValues.name: CONFIRMED_OPT_IN
enumValues.description:
After providing their email address, the customer received a confirmation email which required them to
perform a prescribed action before receiving marketing emails.

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: The customer receives marketing emails, but the original opt-in process is unknown.

types.name: CustomerJourney
types.description: Represents a customer's activity on a shop's online store.

fields.name: customerOrderIndex
fields.description: The position of the current order within the customer's order history.

fields.name: daysToConversion
fields.description: The amount of days between first session and order creation date. First session represents first session since the last order, or first session within the 30 day attribution window, if more than 30 days has passed since the last order.

fields.name: firstVisit
fields.description: The customer's first session going into the shop.

fields.name: lastVisit
fields.description: The last session before an order is made.

fields.name: moments
fields.description: Events preceding a customer order, such as shop sessions.

types.name: CustomerMoment
types.description: Represents events preceding a customer order, such as shop sessions.

fields.name: occurredAt
fields.description: When the customer moment occurred.

types.name: CustomerVisit
types.description: Information about a customer's session on a shop's online store.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: landingPage
fields.description: URL of the first page the customer landed on for the session.

fields.name: landingPageHtml
fields.description: Landing page information with URL linked in HTML. For example, the first page the customer visited was store.myshopify.com/products/1.

fields.name: marketingEvent
fields.description:
Represent actions taken by an app, on behalf of a merchant,
to market Shopify resources such as products, collections, and discounts.

fields.name: occurredAt
fields.description: When the customer moment occurred.

fields.name: referralCode
fields.description:
Marketing referral code from the link that the customer clicked to visit the store.
Supports the following URL attributes: _ref_, _source_, or _r_.
For example, if the URL is myshopifystore.com/products/slide?ref=j2tj1tn2, then this value is j2tj1tn2.

fields.name: referralInfoHtml
fields.description: Referral information with URLs linked in HTML.

fields.name: referrerUrl
fields.description:
Webpage where the customer clicked a link that sent them to the online store.
For example, _https://randomblog.com/page1_ or _android-app://com.google.android.gm_.

fields.name: source
fields.description:
Source from which the customer visited the store, such as a platform (Facebook, Google), email, direct,
a website domain, QR code, or unknown.

fields.name: sourceDescription
fields.description: Describes the source explicitly for first or last session.

fields.name: sourceType
fields.description: Type of marketing tactic.

fields.name: utmParameters
fields.description: A set of UTM parameters gathered from the URL parameters of the referrer.

types.name: MarketingEvent
types.description: Represents actions that market a merchant's store or products.

fields.name: app
fields.description: The app that the marketing event is attributed to.

fields.name: channel
fields.description: The marketing channel used by the marketing event.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A human-readable description of the marketing event.

fields.name: endedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the marketing event ended.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: legacyResourceId
fields.description: The ID of the corresponding resource in the REST Admin API.

fields.name: manageUrl
fields.description: The URL where the marketing event can be managed.

fields.name: previewUrl
fields.description: The URL where the marketing event can be previewed.

fields.name: remoteId
fields.description: An optional ID that helps Shopify validate engagement data.

fields.name: scheduledToEndAt
fields.description: The date and time when the marketing event is scheduled to end.

fields.name: sourceAndMedium
fields.description:
Where the `MarketingEvent` occurred and what kind of content was used.
Because `utmSource` and `utmMedium` are often used interchangeably, this is
based on a combination of `marketingChannel`, `referringDomain`, and `type` to
provide a consistent representation for any given piece of marketing
regardless of the app that created it.

fields.name: startedAt
fields.description: The date and time when the marketing event started.

fields.name: targetTypeDisplayText
fields.description: The display text for the marketing event type.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The marketing event type.

fields.name: utmCampaign
fields.description: The name of the marketing campaign.

fields.name: utmMedium
fields.description: The medium that the marketing campaign is using. Example values: `cpc`, `banner`.

fields.name: utmSource
fields.description: The referrer of the marketing event. Example values: `google`, `newsletter`.

types.name: MarketingTactic
types.description: The available types of marketing event.

enumValues.name: AD
enumValues.description: An ad, such as a Facebook ad.

enumValues.name: MESSAGE
enumValues.description: A messaging app, such as Facebook Messenger.

enumValues.name: NOTIFICATION
enumValues.description: A notification in the Shopify admin.

enumValues.name: DIRECT
enumValues.description: A direct visit to the online store.

enumValues.name: DISPLAY
enumValues.deprecationReason: `DISPLAY` is deprecated. Use `AD` instead.

enumValues.name: SEARCH
enumValues.deprecationReason: `SEARCH` is deprecated. Use `AD` instead.

enumValues.name: FOLLOW_UP
enumValues.deprecationReason: 'FOLLOW_UP' is deprecated. Use 'TRANSACTIONAL' instead.

enumValues.name: RECEIPT
enumValues.deprecationReason: 'RECEIPT' is deprecated. Use 'TRANSACTIONAL' instead.

types.name: DiscountApplication
types.description:
Discount applications capture the intentions of a discount source at
the time of application on an order's line items or shipping lines.

fields.name: allocationMethod
fields.description: The method by which the discount's value is allocated to its entitled items.

fields.name: index
fields.description:
An ordered index that can be used to identify the discount application and indicate the precedence
of the discount application for calculations.

fields.name: targetSelection
fields.description: How the discount amount is distributed on the discounted lines.

fields.name: targetType
fields.description: Whether the discount is applied on line items or shipping lines.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the discount application.

types.name: DiscountApplicationAllocationMethod
types.description: The method by which the discount's value is allocated onto its entitled lines.

enumValues.name: ACROSS
enumValues.description: The value is spread across all entitled lines.

enumValues.name: EACH
enumValues.description: The value is applied onto every entitled line.

enumValues.name: ONE
enumValues.description: The value is specifically applied onto a particular line.

types.name: DiscountApplicationTargetSelection
types.description:
Which lines on the order that the discount is allocated over, of the type
defined by the Discount Application's target_type.

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto all the lines.

enumValues.name: ENTITLED
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto only the lines it is entitled for.

enumValues.name: EXPLICIT
enumValues.description: The discount is allocated onto explicitly chosen lines.

types.name: DiscountApplicationTargetType
types.description: The type of line (i.e. line item or shipping line) on an order that the discount is applicable towards.

enumValues.name: LINE_ITEM
enumValues.description: The discount applies onto line items.

enumValues.name: SHIPPING_LINE
enumValues.description: The discount applies onto shipping lines.

types.name: PricingValue
types.description: The value of the pricing object.

types.name: PricingPercentageValue
types.description: The value of the percentage pricing object.

fields.name: percentage
fields.description: The percentage value of the object.

types.name: OrderDisplayFinancialStatus
types.description: Represents the order's current financial status.

types.name: OrderDisputeSummary
types.description: A summary of the important details for a dispute on an order.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: initiatedAs
fields.description: The type that the dispute was initiated as.

fields.name: protectedByFraudProtect
fields.description: Whether Fraud Protect is protecting chargebacks on the dispute.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The current status of the dispute.

types.name: DisputeStatus
types.description: The possible statuses of a dispute.

types.name: DisputeType
types.description: The possible types for a dispute.

types.name: OrderDisplayFulfillmentStatus
types.description: Represents the order's current fulfillment status. Valid values are: unfulfilled, partial, fulfilled, restocked.

types.name: DraftFulfillment
types.description: Returns unfulfilled line items grouped by their fulfillment service. Each draft fulfillment contains additional information, such as whether the fulfillment requires shipping and whether a shipping label can be printed for it.

fields.name: allowLabelPurchase
fields.description: Whether a label can be purchased.

fields.name: lineItems
fields.description: The line items (which might correspond to a variant) that are part of this draft fulfillment.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: Whether a fulfillment requires shipping.

fields.name: service
fields.description: The service responsible for fulfilling the fulfillment.

types.name: LineItem
types.description: Represents a single line in a shopping cart.

fields.name: canRestock
fields.description: Whether the line item's variant has an ID and inventory is managed by Shopify.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: List of additional information (metafields) about the line item.

fields.name: discountAllocations
fields.description: The discounts that have been allocated onto the line item by discount applications.

fields.name: discountedTotal
fields.description: The total line price after discounts are applied.

fields.name: discountedTotalSet
fields.description: The total line price after discounts are applied in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: discountedUnitPrice
fields.description: The price of a single variant unit after line item discounts are applied.

fields.name: discountedUnitPriceSet
fields.description: The price of a single variant unit after line item discounts are applied in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: fulfillableQuantity
fields.description: The total number of units to fulfill.

fields.name: fulfillmentService
fields.description:
Name of the service provider who fulfilled the order.

Valid values are either **manual** or the name of the provider.
For example, **amazon**, **shipwire**.

fields.name: fulfillmentStatus
fields.description:
The line item's fulfillment status. Returns 'fulfilled' if fulfillableQuantity >= quantity,
'partial' if  fulfillableQuantity > 0, and 'unfulfilled' otherwise.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: image
fields.description: The Image object associated to the line item's variant.

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxWidth` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxHeight` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: crop
args.description: Crops the image according to the specified region. This argument is deprecated: Use `crop` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3. This argument is deprecated: Use `scale` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

fields.name: merchantEditable
fields.description: Whether the line item can be edited or not.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the product.

fields.name: nonFulfillableQuantity
fields.description: A count of the number of line items that cannot be fulfilled.

fields.name: originalTotal
fields.description: Total price (without discounts) of the line item, based on the original unit price of the variant x quantity.

fields.name: originalTotalSet
fields.description: Total price (without discounts) of the line item, based on the original unit price of the  variant x quantity in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: originalUnitPrice
fields.description: Variant price without any discounts applied.

fields.name: originalUnitPriceSet
fields.description: Variant price without any discounts applied in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: product
fields.description: The Product object associated with this line item's variant.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: Number of variant items ordered.

fields.name: refundableQuantity
fields.description: The line item's quantity minus its refundedQuantity.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: Whether physical shipping is required for the variant.

fields.name: restockable
fields.description: Whether the line item's variant has an ID and inventory is managed by Shopify.

fields.name: sku
fields.description: Variant SKU number.

fields.name: staffMember
fields.description: Staff attributed to the initial sale of the line item.

fields.name: taxLines
fields.description: The TaxLine object connected to this line item.

args.name: first
args.description: Truncate the array result to this size.

fields.name: taxable
fields.description: Whether the variant is taxable.

fields.name: tipPaymentGateway
fields.description: The payment gateway used to process the transaction for the tip line item.

fields.name: tipPaymentMethod
fields.description: The name of the credit card brand if available, or the gateway if not. for the tip line item transaction.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the product or variant (this field only applies to custom line items).

fields.name: totalDiscount
fields.description: The sum of all AppliedDiscounts on this line item.

fields.name: totalDiscountSet
fields.description: The sum of all AppliedDiscounts on this line item in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: unfulfilledDiscountedTotal
fields.description: The total discounted value of unfulfilled units.

fields.name: unfulfilledDiscountedTotalSet
fields.description: The total discounted value of unfulfilled units in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: unfulfilledOriginalTotal
fields.description: The total value before discount of all unfulfilled units.

fields.name: unfulfilledOriginalTotalSet
fields.description: The total value before discount of all unfulfilled units in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: unfulfilledQuantity
fields.description: The number of units not yet fulfilled.

fields.name: variant
fields.description: The Variant object associated with this line item.

fields.name: variantTitle
fields.description: Name of the variant.

fields.name: vendor
fields.description: Name of the vendor who made the variant.

types.name: TaxLine
types.description: Represents the information about the tax charged on the associated line item.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The amount of tax to be charged.

fields.name: priceSet
fields.description: The amount of tax to be charged in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: rate
fields.description: The tax rate to be applied.

fields.name: ratePercentage
fields.description: The percentage of the price that the tax rate represents.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The name of the tax.

types.name: DiscountAllocation
types.description: An amount discounting the line that has been allocated by an associated discount application.

fields.name: allocatedAmount
fields.description: Money amount allocated by the discount application.

fields.name: allocatedAmountSet
fields.description: Money amount allocated by the discount application in shop and presentment currencies.

fields.name: discountApplication
fields.description: The discount of which this allocated amount originated from.

fields.name: businesses

fields.name: name
fields.description: The staff member's full name.

fields.name: phone
fields.description: The staff member's phone number.

fields.name: privateData
fields.description: Data used to customize the Shopify admin when the staff member is logged in.

enumValues.name: NOT_FOUND

fields.description: Home greeting messages localized to the client time.

types.name: OrderTransactionKind
types.description: The different kinds of order transactions.

enumValues.name: SALE
enumValues.description: An authorization and capture performed together in a single step.

enumValues.name: CAPTURE
enumValues.description: A transfer of the money that was reserved during the authorization stage.

enumValues.name: AUTHORIZATION
enumValues.description:
An amount reserved against the cardholder's funding source.
Money does not change hands until the authorization is captured.

enumValues.name: VOID
enumValues.description: A cancellation of a pending authorization or capture.

enumValues.name: REFUND
enumValues.description:
A partial or full return of captured funds to the cardholder.
A refund can happen only after a capture is processed.

enumValues.name: CHANGE
enumValues.description: Money returned to the customer when they have paid too much.

enumValues.name: EMV_AUTHORIZATION
enumValues.description: An authorization for a payment taken with an EMV credit card reader.

enumValues.name: SUGGESTED_REFUND
enumValues.description: A suggested refund transaction that can be used to create a refund.

types.name: OrderTransactionStatus

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error while processing the transaction.

types.name: OrderTransactionErrorCode
types.description: A standardized error code, independent of the payment provider.

enumValues.name: INVALID_NUMBER
enumValues.description: The format of the card number is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INVALID_EXPIRY_DATE
enumValues.description: The format of the expiry date is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INVALID_CVC
enumValues.description: The format of the CVC is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_CVC
enumValues.description: The CVC does not match the card number.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ZIP
enumValues.description: The ZIP or postal code does not match the card number.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ADDRESS
enumValues.description: The address does not match the card number.

enumValues.name: PROCESSING_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error while processing the payment.

enumValues.name: PICK_UP_CARD
enumValues.description: The card has been reported as lost or stolen, and the card issuer has requested that the merchant keep the card and call the number on the back.

enumValues.name: CONFIG_ERROR
enumValues.description: There is an error in the gateway or merchant configuration.

enumValues.name: TEST_MODE_LIVE_CARD
enumValues.description: A real card was used but the gateway was in test mode.

enumValues.name: UNSUPPORTED_FEATURE
enumValues.description: The gateway or merchant configuration doesn't support a feature, such as network tokenization.

enumValues.name: GENERIC_ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an unknown error with processing the payment.

enumValues.name: INVALID_COUNTRY
enumValues.description: The payment method is not available in the customer's country.

enumValues.name: INVALID_AMOUNT
enumValues.description: The amount is either too high or too low for the provider.

enumValues.name: PAYMENT_METHOD_UNAVAILABLE
enumValues.description: The payment method is momentarily unavailable.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_AMOUNT_CHARGED
enumValues.description: The maximum amount has been captured.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_AMOUNT_REFUNDED
enumValues.description: The maximum amount has been refunded.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_AUTHORIZATIONS_CAPTURED
enumValues.description: The maximum of 10 authorizations has been captured for an order.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_MAX_REFUNDS_PROCESSED
enumValues.description: The maximum of 10 refunds has been processed for an order.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_ORDER_REFERENCE_CANCELED
enumValues.description: The order was canceled, which canceled all open authorizations.

enumValues.name: AMAZON_PAYMENTS_STALE
enumValues.description: The order was not confirmed within three hours.

types.name: ExchangeErrorCode
types.description: Possible error codes that could be returned by an exchange.

enumValues.name: CHECKOUT
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where an error occurs in checkout. Usually a catch-all error case.

enumValues.name: CHECKOUT_BILLING_ADDRESS_BLANK
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where the checkout's billing address is blank.

enumValues.name: CHECKOUT_DISCOUNT
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where an error occurs on the discount. Usually a catch-all error case.

enumValues.name: CHECKOUT_DISCOUNT_CODE_DEPLETED
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where the discount code on checkout is depleted.

enumValues.name: CHECKOUT_DISCOUNT_CODE_NOT_APPLICABLE
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where the discount code on checkout is not applicable (does not meet conditions).

enumValues.name: CHECKOUT_DISCOUNT_CODE_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where the discount code on checkout is not found.

enumValues.name: CHECKOUT_LINE_ITEM
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where an error occurs on the checkout line item.

enumValues.name: CHECKOUT_LINE_ITEM_INVALID_SPECIFICATION
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where a checkout line item has an invalid specification (variant, number of items).

enumValues.name: CHECKOUT_ORDER_CONTAINS_DISCOUNT_CODE_AND_MANUAL_DISCOUNT
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where a checkout order contains both a discount code and a manual discount.

enumValues.name: EXCHANGE_ALREADY_COMPLETED
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where exchange is already completed.

enumValues.name: EXCHANGE_CHECKOUT_ALREADY_COMPLETED
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where exchange related checkout is already completed.

enumValues.name: EXCHANGE_CREDIT_GREATER_THAN_CHECKOUT_PRICE
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where exchange credit amount is greater than checkout price.

enumValues.name: EXCHANGE_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where exchange is not found.

enumValues.name: EXCHANGE_NOT_READY_TO_COMPLETE
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where exchange is not ready to be completed.

enumValues.name: EXCHANGE_PARENT_ORDER_IS_LOCKED
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where the parent order is locked and exchange cannot be completed.

enumValues.name: PAYMENT_EXCHANGE_CREDIT
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where an error occurs with the exchange credit payment.

enumValues.name: PAYMENT_UNIQUE_TOKEN_NOT_SPECIFIED
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where the payment's unique token is not specified.

enumValues.name: RECEIPT_RECIPIENT_INVALID_EMAIL_ADDRESS
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where the receipt recipient's email address is invalid.

enumValues.name: RECEIPT_RECIPIENT_INVALID_PHONE_NUMBER
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where the receipt recipient's phone number is invalid.

enumValues.name: RECEIPT_RECIPIENT_UNREACHABLE
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where the exchange receipt recipient is unreachable.

enumValues.name: RECEIPT_REQUIRES_EMAIL_OR_PHONE
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where the exchange receipt requires either an email or phone number.

enumValues.name: REFUND
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where an error occurs on the refund. Usually a catch-all error case.

enumValues.name: REFUND_LINE_ITEM
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where an error occurs on a refund line item.

enumValues.name: REFUND_LINE_ITEM_BLANK
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where a refund line item is blank.

enumValues.name: REFUND_LINE_ITEM_NOT_FULFILLED
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where a refund line item being exchanged is not fulfilled.

enumValues.name: REFUND_MISSING_TRANSACTIONS
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where the refund is missing transactions.

enumValues.name: REFUND_SHIPPING
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where an error occurs when refunding shipping. Usually a catch-all error case.

enumValues.name: REFUND_SHIPPING_CANNOT_BE_NEGATIVE
enumValues.description: ExchangeError when refund shipping amount is less than 0.

enumValues.name: REFUND_SHIPPING_MORE_THAN_REMAINING
enumValues.description: ExchangeError when refund shipping amount is greater than remaining shipping.

enumValues.name: REFUND_TRANSACTION
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where an error occurs with a refund transaction.

enumValues.name: REFUND_TRANSACTIONS_NIL
enumValues.description: ExchangeError where the refund transactions are nil.

types.name: Fulfillment
types.description: Represents a fulfillment. In Shopify, a fulfillment represents a shipment of one or more items in an order. When an order has been completely fulfilled, it means that all the items that are included in the order have been sent to the customer. There can be more than one fulfillment for an order.

fields.description: Whether the risk level is shown in the Shopify admin. If false, then this order risk is ignored when Shopify determines the overall risk level for the order.

The likelihood that an order is fraudulent, based on this order risk.

The level can be set by Shopify risk analysis or by an app.

fields.description: The risk message that's shown to the merchant in the Shopify admin.

types.name: OrderRiskRecommendation
types.description: The risk recommendation for an order. An order has a single overall risk recommendation which is the result of one of more risk assessments. The recommendation suggests the action one should take for an order with regards to its risk of fraud.

fields.name: assessments
fields.description: The assessments used to create this recommendation.

fields.name: recommendation
fields.description: The recommendation.

types.name: OrderRiskRecommendationResult
types.description: List of possible values for an OrderRiskRecommendation recommendation.

types.description: Represents a risk assessment for an order.

fields.description: Optional facts used to describe the risk assessment.

args.name: first
args.description: Truncate the array result to this size.

args.name: sortKey
args.description: The sort order for the risk assessment facts.

fields.name: providerName
fields.description: The provider of the risk assessment.

fields.name: result
fields.description: The likelihood that the order is fraudulent, based on this risk assessment.

types.name: RiskAssessmentResult
types.description: List of possible values for a RiskAssessment result.

types.name: RiskFact
types.description: A risk fact belongs to a single risk assessment and serves to provide additional context for an assessment. Risk facts are not necessarily tied to the result of the recommendation.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A description of the fact.

fields.name: sentiment
fields.description: Indicates whether the fact is a negative, neutral or positive contributor with regards to risk.

types.name: RiskFactSentiment
types.description: List of possible values for a RiskFact sentiment.

types.name: FactSortKeys
types.description: Specifies the sorting order for the facts of an assessment.

enumValues.name: RESULT
enumValues.description:
Facts are sorted by sentiment according to the assessment result.
For a low assessment they are sorted in ascending order of sentiment: positve, neutral, negative.
For any other assessment they are sorted in descending order of sentiment negative, neutral, positive.

enumValues.name: DEFAULT
enumValues.description: The default value for the sort key returns the facts unsorted.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Unique identifier for the draft order, which is unique within the store. For example, _#D1223_.

fields.name: note2
fields.description: Text from an optional note attached to the draft order.

fields.name: order
fields.description: Order that was created from this draft order.

fields.name: shippingAddress
fields.description: Shipping mailing address of the customer.

fields.name: shippingLine
fields.description: Line item that contains the shipping costs.

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the draft order.

fields.name: subtotalPrice
fields.description: Subtotal of the line items and their discounts (does not contain shipping charges or shipping discounts, or taxes).

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Tags added to the draft order.

fields.name: taxExempt
fields.description: Whether the draft order is tax exempt.

fields.name: taxLines
fields.description: Total amount of taxes charged for each line item and shipping line.

fields.name: taxesIncluded
fields.description: Whether the line item prices include taxes.

fields.name: totalPrice
fields.description: Total amount of the draft order (includes taxes, shipping charges, and discounts).

fields.name: totalShippingPrice
fields.description: Total shipping charge for the draft order.

fields.name: totalTax
fields.description: Total amount of taxes for the draft order.

fields.name: totalWeight
fields.description: Total weight (grams) of the draft order.

fields.name: updatedAt
fields.description:
Date and time when the draft order was last changed.
The format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss (for example, 2016-02-05 17:04:01).

types.name: DraftOrderLineItem
types.description: Represents a line item included in a draft order.

fields.name: appliedDiscount
fields.description: Discount which will be applied to the line item or the overall order.

fields.name: custom
fields.description:
Whether this is a product variant line item, or a custom line item.
If set to true indicates a custom line item. If set to false indicates a product variant line item.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: List of additional information (metafields) about the line item.

fields.name: discountedTotal
fields.description: Line item price after discounts are applied.

fields.name: discountedUnitPrice
fields.description: The `discountedTotal` divided by `quantity`, resulting in the value of the discount per unit.

fields.name: fulfillmentService
fields.description:
Name of the service provider who fulfilled the order.

Valid values are either **manual** or the name of the provider.
For example, **amazon**, **shipwire**.

fields.name: grams
fields.description: Weight in grams. Can only be specified if this is a custom line item.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: image
fields.description: Image associated with the draft order line item.

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxWidth` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxHeight` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: crop
args.description: Crops the image according to the specified region. This argument is deprecated: Use `crop` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3. This argument is deprecated: Use `scale` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

fields.name: isGiftCard
fields.description: Whether the line item represents the puchase of a gift card.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the product.

fields.name: originalTotal
fields.description: Total price (without discounts) of the line item, based on the original unit price of the variant x quantity.

fields.name: originalUnitPrice
fields.description: Variant price without any discounts applied.

fields.name: product
fields.description: The product corresponding to the line item’s product variant.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: Number of variant items requested in the draft order.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: Whether physical shipping is required for the variant.

fields.name: sku
fields.description: Variant SKU number.

fields.name: taxLines
fields.description: A list of tax line objects, each of which details the total taxes applicable to the order.

fields.name: taxable
fields.description: Whether the variant is taxable.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the product or variant (this field only applies to custom line items).

fields.name: totalDiscount
fields.description: Total value of the discount applied to the line item.

fields.name: variant
fields.description: Associated variant for the line item.

fields.name: variantTitle
fields.description: Name of the variant.

fields.name: vendor
fields.description: Name of the vendor who made the variant.

fields.name: weight
fields.description: Weight unit and value for a draft order line item.

enumValues.description: The draft order has been paid.

enumValues.description: An invoice for the draft order has been sent to the customer.

enumValues.description: The draft order is open. It has not been paid, and an invoice hasn't been sent.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsAccount
types.description:
Balance and payout information for a
[Shopify Payments](https://help.shopify.com/manual/payments/shopify-payments/getting-paid-with-shopify-payments)
account. Balance includes all balances for the currencies supported by the shop.
You can also query for a list of payouts, where each payout includes the corresponding currencyCode field.

fields.description: Whether the Shopify Payments setup is completed.

fields.name: balance
fields.description: Current balances in all currencies for the account.

fields.name: bankAccounts
fields.description: All bank accounts configured for the Shopify Payments account.

Payouts represent the movement of money between a merchant's Shopify
Payments balance and their bank account.

fields.description: The bank account for the payout.

fields.name: gross
fields.description: The total amount and currency of the payout.

fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.description:
The exact time when the payout was issued. The payout only contains
balance transactions that were available at this time.

fields.description: The ID of the corresponding resource in the REST Admin API.

fields.name: net
fields.description: The total amount and currency of the payout.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The transfer status of the payout.

fields.name: summary
fields.description: The summary of the payout.

fields.name: transactionType
fields.description: The direction of the payout.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutStatus
types.description: The transfer status of the payout.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description:
The payout has been created and had transactions assigned to it, but
it has not yet been submitted to the bank.

enumValues.name: IN_TRANSIT
enumValues.description: The payout has been submitted to the bank.

enumValues.name: PAID
enumValues.description: The payout has been successfully deposited into the bank.

enumValues.name: FAILED
enumValues.description: The payout has been declined by the bank.

enumValues.name: CANCELED
enumValues.description: The payout has been canceled by Shopify.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutSchedule
types.description: The payment schedule for a payments account.

fields.name: interval
fields.description: The interval at which payouts are sent to the connected bank account.

fields.name: monthlyAnchor
fields.description:
The day of the month funds will be paid out.

The value can be any day of the month from the 1st to the 31st.
If the payment interval is set to monthly, this value will be used.
Payouts scheduled between 29-31st of the month are sent on the last day of shorter months.

fields.name: weeklyAnchor
fields.description:
The day of the week funds will be paid out.

The value can be any weekday from Monday to Friday.
If the payment interval is set to weekly, this value will be used.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutInterval
types.description: The interval at which payouts are sent to the connected bank account.

enumValues.name: WEEKLY
enumValues.description: Each week, on the day of week specified by weeklyAnchor.

enumValues.name: MONTHLY
enumValues.description: Each month, on the day of month specified by monthlyAnchor.

enumValues.name: MANUAL
enumValues.description: Payouts will not be automatically made.

types.name: DayOfTheWeek

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsDispute
types.description: A dispute occurs when a buyer questions the legitimacy of a charge with their financial institution.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The total amount disputed by the cardholder.

fields.description: The deadline for evidence submission.

fields.description: The date when evidence was sent. Returns null if evidence has not yet been sent.

fields.description: The date when this dispute was resolved. Returns null if the dispute is not yet resolved.

fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.description: The date when this dispute was initiated.

fields.description: The ID of the corresponding resource in the REST Admin API.

fields.description: The order that contains the charge that is under dispute.

fields.description: The reason of the dispute.

fields.description: The current state of the dispute.

fields.description: Indicates if this dispute is still in the inquiry phase or has turned into a chargeback.

types.description: Details regarding a dispute reason.

fields.description: The raw code provided by the payment network.

fields.name: reason
fields.description: The reason for the dispute provided by the cardholder's banks.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsDisputeReason
types.description: The reason for the dispute provided by the cardholder's bank.

enumValues.name: FRAUDULENT
enumValues.description: The cardholder claims that they didn’t authorize the payment.

enumValues.name: GENERAL
enumValues.description: The dispute is uncategorized, so you should contact the customer for additional details to find out why the payment was disputed.

enumValues.name: UNRECOGNIZED
enumValues.description: The customer doesn’t recognize the payment appearing on their card statement.

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE
enumValues.description: The customer claims they were charged multiple times for the same product or service.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION_CANCELLED
enumValues.description: The customer claims that you continued to charge them after a subscription was canceled.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_UNACCEPTABLE
enumValues.description: The product or service was received but was defective, damaged, or not as described.

enumValues.name: PRODUCT_NOT_RECEIVED
enumValues.description: The customer claims they did not receive the products or services purchased.

enumValues.name: CREDIT_NOT_PROCESSED
enumValues.description: The customer claims that the purchased product was returned or the transaction was otherwise canceled, but you have not yet provided a refund or credit.

enumValues.name: INCORRECT_ACCOUNT_DETAILS
enumValues.description: The customer account associated with the purchase is incorrect.

enumValues.name: INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS
enumValues.description: The customer's bank account has insufficient funds.

enumValues.name: BANK_CANNOT_PROCESS
enumValues.description: The customer's bank cannot process the charge.

enumValues.name: DEBIT_NOT_AUTHORIZED
enumValues.description: The customer's bank cannot proceed with the debit since it has not been authorized.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_INITIATED
enumValues.description: The customer initiated the dispute, so you should contact the customer for additional details to find out why the payment was disputed.

fields.name: orderBulkAddTags
fields.description:
Adds tags to orders in bulk. When supplying a search, will
perform the operations in a background job.

args.name: search
args.description: Search query on which to filter orders. If blank, then operation will apply to all orders. This argument must not be supplied if you use the `ids` argument.

args.name: ids
args.description: List of orders to be operated on. If blank, then operation will apply to all orders. This argument must not be supplied if you use the `search` argument.

args.name: tags
args.description: List of tags to be added.

fields.name: orderBulkCapture
fields.description:
Captures payment for orders in bulk. Currently, any capture performed through this endpoint will
be done in a background job.

args.name: search
args.description: Search query on which to filter orders. If blank, then will apply to all orders. This argument must not be supplied if you use the `ids` argument.

args.name: ids
args.description: List of orders to be captured. If blank, then will apply to all orders. This argument must not be supplied if you use the `search` argument.

fields.name: orderBulkClose
fields.description:
Archives/closes the orders in bulk. When supplying a search, will
perform the operations in a background job.

args.name: search
args.description: Search query on which to filter orders. If blank, then will apply to all orders. This argument must not be supplied if you use the `ids` argument.

args.name: ids
args.description: List of orders to be closed. If blank, then will apply to all orders. This argument must not be supplied if you use the `search` argument.

fields.name: orderBulkFulfill
fields.description:
Fulfills the orders in bulk. When supplying a search, will
perform the operations in a background job.

args.name: search
args.description: Search query on which to filter orders. If blank, then will apply to all orders. This argument must not be supplied if you use the `ids` argument.

args.name: ids
args.description: List of orders to be fulfilled. If blank, then will apply to all orders. This argument must not be supplied if you use the `search` argument.

args.name: notifyCustomer
args.description: Whether the customer should be notified. If set to `true`, then an email will be sent when the fulfillment is created or updated. If not supplied, defaults to `false`. For orders that were initially created using the API, the default value is also `false`. For all other orders, the default value is true.

fields.name: orderBulkOpen
fields.description:
Unarchives/opens the orders in bulk. When supplying a search, will
perform the operations in a background job.

args.name: search
args.description: Search query on which to filter orders. If blank, then will apply to all orders. This argument must not be supplied if you use the `ids` argument.

args.name: ids
args.description: List of orders to be opened. If blank, then will apply to all orders. This argument must not be supplied if you use the `search` argument.

fields.name: orderBulkRemoveTags
fields.description:
Removes tags from orders in bulk. When supplying a search, will
perform the operations in a background job.

args.name: search
args.description: Search query on which to filter orders. If blank, then operation will apply to all orders. This argument must not be supplied if you use the `ids` argument.

args.name: ids
args.description: List of orders to be operated on. If blank, then operation will apply to all orders. This argument must not be supplied if you use the `search` argument.

args.name: tags
args.description: List of tags to be removed.

fields.name: orderBulkShippingLabelsCreate
fields.description:
Given a list of orderIds and a locationId, will create draft shipping labels for the eligible
orders at that locationId.

args.name: orderIds
args.description:
List of orders to begin purchasing shipping labels for. Note: Not all orders

types.name: CollectionInput
types.description: Specifies the input fields required to create a collection.

inputFields.name: descriptionHtml
inputFields.description: The description of the collection, in HTML format.

inputFields.name: handle
inputFields.description: A unique human-friendly string for the collection. Automatically generated from the collection's title.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Specifies the collection to update or create a new collection if absent.

inputFields.name: image
inputFields.description: The image associated with the collection.

inputFields.name: products
inputFields.description: Initial list of collection products. Only valid with `productCreate` and without rules.

inputFields.name: publications
inputFields.description: Initial list of collection publications. Only valid with `productCreate`. This argument is deprecated: Use PublishablePublish instead.

inputFields.name: ruleSet
inputFields.description: The rules used to assign products to the collection.

inputFields.name: templateSuffix
inputFields.description: The theme template used when viewing the collection in a store.

inputFields.name: sortOrder
inputFields.description: The order in which the collection's products are sorted.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Required for creating a new collection.

inputFields.name: seo
inputFields.description: SEO information for the collection.

inputFields.name: redirectNewHandle
inputFields.description:
Indicates whether a redirect is required after a new handle has been provided.
If true, then the old handle is redirected to the new one automatically.

types.name: ImageInput
types.description: Specifies the input fields for an image.

inputFields.name: src
inputFields.description: The URL of the image. May be a signed upload URL.

types.name: CollectionPublicationInput
types.description: Specifies the publications to which a collection will be published.

inputFields.name: publicationId
inputFields.description: The ID of the publication.

inputFields.name: channelId
inputFields.description: The ID of the channel. This argument is deprecated: Use publicationId instead.

inputFields.name: channelHandle
inputFields.description: This argument is deprecated: Use publicationId instead.

types.name: CollectionRuleSetInput
types.description: Specifies a rule set for the collection.

inputFields.name: appliedDisjunctively
inputFields.description:
Whether products must match any or all of the rules to be included in the collection.
If true, then products must match one or more of the rules to be included in the collection.
If false, then products must match all of the rules to be included in the collection.

inputFields.name: rules
inputFields.description: The rules used to assign products to the collection.

types.name: CollectionRuleInput
types.description: Specifies a rule to associate with a collection.

inputFields.name: column
inputFields.description: The attribute that the rule focuses on (for example, `title` or `product_type`).

inputFields.name: relation
inputFields.description: The type of operator that the rule is based on (for example, `equals`, `contains`, or `not_equals`).

inputFields.name: condition
inputFields.description: The value that the operator is applied to (for example, `Hats`).

types.description: Specifies the input fields for a metafield.

types.name: SEOInput
types.description: SEO information.

inputFields.name: title

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: SEO description of the product.

types.name: DiscountUserError

fields.description: Path to the input field which caused the error.

types.name: DiscountErrorCode
types.description: Possible error codes that could be returned by a discounts mutation.

enumValues.name: EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Input value should be equal to allowed value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN
enumValues.description: Input value should be greater than minimum allowed value.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Input value should be greater than or equal to minimum allowed value.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: Input value should be less or equal to maximum allowed value.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN
enumValues.description: Input value should be less than maximum allowed value.

enumValues.name: END_DATE_BEFORE_START_DATE
enumValues.description: End date should be after start date.
enumValues.deprecationReason: This error code has been deprecated to a generic one. See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1avBWJUj-2kB19aVQuEbAqcy2BmgyVPudZv9aqss9nDM/edit#gid=0

enumValues.name: EXCEEDED_MAX_NUMBER_OF_DISCOUNT
enumValues.description: Exceeded maximum number of discounts for this shop.
enumValues.deprecationReason: This error code has been deprecated to a generic one. See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1avBWJUj-2kB19aVQuEbAqcy2BmgyVPudZv9aqss9nDM/edit#gid=0

enumValues.name: MINIMUM_SUBTOTAL_AND_QUANTITY_RANGE_BOTH_PRESENT
enumValues.description: Cannot have both minimum subtotal and quantity present.

enumValues.name: ACTIVE_PERIOD_OVERLAP
enumValues.description: Active period overlaps with other automatic discounts. At any given time, only one automatic discount can be active.

enumValues.name: INVALID_COLLECTION
enumValues.deprecationReason: This error code has been deprecated to a generic one. See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1avBWJUj-2kB19aVQuEbAqcy2BmgyVPudZv9aqss9nDM/edit#gid=0

enumValues.name: INVALID_PRODUCT
enumValues.deprecationReason: This error code has been deprecated to a generic one. See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1avBWJUj-2kB19aVQuEbAqcy2BmgyVPudZv9aqss9nDM/edit#gid=0

enumValues.name: INVALID_VARIANT
enumValues.deprecationReason: This error code has been deprecated to a generic one. See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1avBWJUj-2kB19aVQuEbAqcy2BmgyVPudZv9aqss9nDM/edit#gid=0

enumValues.name: CANNOT_COMBINE_COLLECTIONS_WITH_PRODUCTS_OR_VARIANTS
enumValues.description: Cannot select collections if product or variants are selected.
enumValues.deprecationReason: This error code has been deprecated to a generic one. See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1avBWJUj-2kB19aVQuEbAqcy2BmgyVPudZv9aqss9nDM/edit#gid=0

enumValues.name: VARIANT_ALREADY_SELECTED_THROUGH_PRODUCT
enumValues.description: Variant is already selected through product.
enumValues.deprecationReason: This error code has been deprecated to a generic one. See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1avBWJUj-2kB19aVQuEbAqcy2BmgyVPudZv9aqss9nDM/edit#gid=0

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE_COLLECTION
enumValues.deprecationReason: This error code has been deprecated to a generic one. See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1avBWJUj-2kB19aVQuEbAqcy2BmgyVPudZv9aqss9nDM/edit#gid=0

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE_PRODUCT
enumValues.deprecationReason: This error code has been deprecated to a generic one. See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1avBWJUj-2kB19aVQuEbAqcy2BmgyVPudZv9aqss9nDM/edit#gid=0

enumValues.name: DUPLICATE_VARIANT
enumValues.deprecationReason: This error code has been deprecated to a generic one. See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1avBWJUj-2kB19aVQuEbAqcy2BmgyVPudZv9aqss9nDM/edit#gid=0

enumValues.name: EACH_MUST_BE_FALSE
enumValues.description: Cannot target each item when all items selected.
enumValues.deprecationReason: This error code has been deprecated to a generic one. See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1avBWJUj-2kB19aVQuEbAqcy2BmgyVPudZv9aqss9nDM/edit#gid=0

enumValues.name: EXCEEDED_MAX_COLLECTION
enumValues.description: Exceeded maximum number of collections for this discount.
enumValues.deprecationReason: This error code has been deprecated to a generic one. See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1avBWJUj-2kB19aVQuEbAqcy2BmgyVPudZv9aqss9nDM/edit#gid=0

enumValues.name: EXCEEDED_MAX_PRODUCT
enumValues.description: Exceeded maximum number of products for this discount.
enumValues.deprecationReason: This error code has been deprecated to a generic one. See https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1avBWJUj-2kB19aVQuEbAqcy2BmgyVPudZv9aqss9nDM/edit#gid=0

enumValues.name: EXCEEDED_MAX_VARIANT

types.name: DiscountAutomaticBxgyInput
types.description: Specifies input field to create or update automatic bogo discount.

inputFields.name: startsAt
inputFields.description: The date and time when the discount starts.

inputFields.name: endsAt
inputFields.description: The date and time when the discount ends. For open-ended discounts, use `null`.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: The title of the discount.

inputFields.name: usesPerOrderLimit
inputFields.description: The maximum number of times that the discount can be applied to an order.

inputFields.name: customerBuys
inputFields.description: The qualifying items and the quantity of each one that the customer has to buy to be eligible for the discount.

inputFields.name: customerGets
inputFields.description: The qualifying items in an order, the quantity of each one, and the total value of the discount.

types.name: DiscountCustomerBuysInput
types.description: Specifies the prerequisite items and prerequisite quantity.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: The quantity of prerequisite items.

inputFields.name: items
inputFields.description: The IDs of items that the customer buys. The items can be either collections or products.

types.name: DiscountCustomerBuysValueInput
types.description: Specifies the prerequisite quantity for the discount.

inputFields.name: quantity
inputFields.description: The quantity of prerequisite items.

types.name: DiscountItemsInput
types.description: Specifies the items attached to a discount.

inputFields.name: products
inputFields.description: The products and product variants that are attached to a discount.

inputFields.name: collections
inputFields.description: The collections that are attached to a discount.

inputFields.name: all
inputFields.description: Whether all items should be selected.

types.name: DiscountProductsInput
types.description: Specifies the products and product variants attached to a discount.

inputFields.name: productIds
inputFields.description: Specifies list of product ids. This argument is deprecated: Use `products_to_add` and `products_to_remove` instead.

inputFields.name: productVariantIds
inputFields.description: Specifies list of product variant ids. This argument is deprecated: Use `product_variants_to_add` and `product_variants_to_remove` instead.

types.name: DiscountCollectionsInput
types.description: Specifies the collections attached to a discount.

inputFields.name: collectionIds
inputFields.description: Specifies list of collection ids. This argument is deprecated: Use `add` and `remove` instead.

types.name: DiscountCustomerGetsInput
types.description: Specifies the items that will be discounted, the quantity of items that will be discounted, and the value of discount.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description: The quantity of items discounted and the discount value.

inputFields.name: items
inputFields.description: The IDs of the items that the customer gets. The items can be either collections or products.

types.name: DiscountCustomerGetsValueInput
types.description: Specifies the quantity of items discounted and the discount value.

inputFields.name: discountOnQuantity
inputFields.description: The quantity of the items that are discounted and the discount value.

inputFields.name: percentage
inputFields.description: The percentage value of the discount. Value must be between 0.00 - 1.00.

inputFields.name: discountAmount
inputFields.description: The value of the discount.

types.name: DiscountOnQuantityInput
types.description: Specifies the quantity of items discounted and the discount value.

inputFields.name: quantity
inputFields.description: The quantity of items that are discounted.

inputFields.name: effect
inputFields.description: The percentage value of the discount.

types.name: DiscountEffectInput
types.description: Specifies how the discount will be applied. Currently, only percentage off is supported.

inputFields.name: percentage
inputFields.description: The percentage value of the discount. Value must be between 0.00 - 1.00.

types.name: DiscountAmountInput
types.description: Specifies the value of the discount and how it is applied.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The value of the discount.

inputFields.name: each
inputFields.description: If true, then the discount is applied to each of the entitled items. If false, then the amount is split across all of the entitled items. This argument is deprecated: Use `applies_on_each_item` instead.

fields.name: totalTax

types.name: CalculatedDraftOrderLineItem
types.description: The computed line items for a draft order.

fields.name: appliedDiscount
fields.description: Discount applied to the line item.

fields.name: custom
fields.description: Indicates if this is a product variant line item, or a custom line item.

fields.name: customAttributes
fields.description: List of additional information (metafields) about the line item.

fields.name: discountedTotal
fields.description: Total price with discounts applied.

fields.name: discountedUnitPrice
fields.description: Unit price with discounts applied.

fields.name: fulfillmentService
fields.description:
Name of the service provider who fulfilled the order.

Valid values are either **manual** or the name of the provider.
For example, **amazon**, **shipwire**.

fields.name: image
fields.description: Image associated with the draft order line item.

fields.name: isGiftCard
fields.description: Indicates whether the line item represents the puchase of a gift card.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the product.

fields.name: originalTotal
fields.description: Total price (without discounts) of the line item, based on the original unit price of the variant x quantity.

fields.name: originalUnitPrice
fields.description: Variant price without any discounts applied.

fields.name: product
fields.description: Product associated with the draft order line item.

fields.name: quantity
fields.description: Number of variant items requested in the draft order.

fields.name: requiresShipping
fields.description: Whether physical shipping is required for the variant.

fields.name: sku
fields.description: Variant SKU number.

fields.name: taxable
fields.description: Whether the variant is taxable.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the product or variant (this field only applies to custom line items).

fields.name: totalDiscount
fields.description: Total value of the discount.

fields.name: variant
fields.description: Variant associated with the draft order line item.

fields.name: variantTitle
fields.description: Name of the variant.

fields.name: vendor
fields.description: Name of the vendor who made the variant.

fields.name: weight
fields.description: Weight unit and value for a draft order line item.

types.name: DraftOrderInput
types.description: The input fields used to create or update a draft order.

inputFields.name: appliedDiscount
inputFields.description:
The discount that will be applied to the draft order.
A draft order line item can have one discount. A draft order can also have one order-level discount.

inputFields.name: billingAddress
inputFields.description: The mailing address associated with the payment method.

inputFields.name: customerId
inputFields.description: Customer associated with the draft order.

inputFields.name: customAttributes
inputFields.description: Extra information added to the customer.

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: The customer's email address.

inputFields.name: lineItems
inputFields.description:
Product variant line item or custom line item associated to the draft order.
Each draft order must include at least one line item.

inputFields.name: metafields
inputFields.description: Metafields attached to the draft order.

inputFields.name: note
inputFields.description: The text of an optional note that a shop owner can attach to the draft order.

inputFields.name: shippingAddress
inputFields.description: The mailing address to where the order will be shipped.

inputFields.name: shippingLine
inputFields.description: A shipping line object, which details the shipping method used.

inputFields.name: tags
inputFields.description:
Additional short descriptors, commonly used for filtering and searching,
formatted as a string of comma-separated values.

inputFields.name: taxExempt
inputFields.description:
Whether or not taxes are exempt for the draft order.
If false, then Shopify will refer to the taxable field for each line item.
If a customer is applied to the draft order, then Shopify will use the customer's tax exempt field instead.

inputFields.name: useCustomerDefaultAddress
inputFields.description: Sent as part of a draft order object to load customer shipping information.

types.name: DraftOrderAppliedDiscountInput
types.description: The input fields for applying an order-level discount to a draft order.

inputFields.name: amount
inputFields.description: The applied amount of the discount.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: Reason for the discount.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Title of the discount.

inputFields.name: value
inputFields.description:
The value of the discount.
If the type of the discount is fixed amount, then this is a fixed dollar amount.
If the type is percentage, then this is the percentage.

inputFields.name: valueType
inputFields.description: The type of discount.

types.name: DraftOrderLineItemInput
types.description: The input fields used to create a line item for a draft order.

inputFields.name: appliedDiscount
inputFields.description: Discount which will be applied to the line item.

inputFields.name: customAttributes
inputFields.description: Represents a generic custom attribute using a key value pair.

inputFields.name: grams
inputFields.description: Ignored when variant ID is provided. This argument is deprecated: Use `weight` instead.

inputFields.name: originalUnitPrice
inputFields.description: Ignored when variant ID is provided.

inputFields.name: quantity
inputFields.description: The number of products that were purchased.

inputFields.name: requiresShipping
inputFields.description: Ignored when variant ID is provided.

inputFields.name: sku
inputFields.description: Ignored when variant ID is provided.

inputFields.name: taxable
inputFields.description: Ignored when variant ID is provided.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: Ignored when variant ID is provided.

inputFields.name: variantId
inputFields.description:
The ID of the product variant corresponding to the line item.
Null if custom line item. Required if product variant line item.

inputFields.name: weight
inputFields.description:
Specifies the weight unit and value inputs.
Ignored when variant ID or product ID are provided.

tactics except Storefront App. This utm param can be only set once and never modified.

inputFields.description: The value of the barcode associated with the product.

inputFields.description: The Harmonized System Code (or HS Tariff Code) for the variant.

inputFields.description: Specifies the product variant to update or create a new variant if absent.

inputFields.description: The ID of the image that's associated with the variant.

inputFields.description: The URL of an image to associate with the variant.  This field can only be used through mutations that create product images and must match one of the URLs being created on the product.

inputFields.name: inventoryManagement
inputFields.description:
The fulfillment service that tracks the number of items in stock for the product variant. If you track the inventory yourself using the admin, then set the value to `shopify`. Valid values: `shopify` or the handle of a fulfillment service that has inventory management enabled.
 This argument is deprecated: Use tracked attribute on `inventoryItem` instead.

inputFields.description: Whether customers are allowed to place an order for the product variant when it's out of stock.

inputFields.name: inventoryQuantity
inputFields.description: This argument is deprecated: Use `inventoryQuantities` instead.

inputFields.name: inventoryQuantityAdjustment
inputFields.description: This argument is deprecated: Use the `inventoryAdjustQuantity` mutation instead.

inputFields.description: Create only field. The inventory quantities at each location where the variant is stocked.

inputFields.name: inventoryItem
inputFields.description: Inventory Item associated with the variant, used for unit cost.

inputFields.name: metafields
inputFields.description: Additional customizable information about the product variant.

inputFields.name: options
inputFields.description: The custom properties that a shop owner uses to define product variants.

inputFields.name: position
inputFields.description: The order of the product variant in the list of product variants. The first position in the list is 1.

inputFields.name: price
inputFields.description: The price of the variant.

inputFields.name: productId
inputFields.description: Create only required field. Specifies the product on which to create the variant.

inputFields.name: requiresShipping
inputFields.description: Whether the variant requires shipping.

inputFields.name: sku
inputFields.description: The SKU for the variant.

inputFields.name: taxable
inputFields.description: Whether the variant is taxable.

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: This argument is deprecated: Variant title is not a writable field; it is generated from the selected variant options.

inputFields.name: taxCode
inputFields.description: The tax code associated with the variant.

inputFields.name: weight
inputFields.description: The weight of the variant.

inputFields.name: weightUnit
inputFields.description: The unit of weight that's used to measure the variant.
