types.name: ShopifyPaymentsBalanceDebitPayload
types.description: Return type for `shopifyPaymentsBalanceDebit` mutation.

fields.name: debit
fields.description:
The balance debit that represents the movement of funds away from a Shopify Payments
          account's balance to a target account. This target account is selected depending
          on the reason behind the balance debit.

fields.name: userErrors
fields.description: List of errors that occurred executing the mutation.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsBalanceDebit
types.description:
A balance debit represents the movement of funds away from a Shopify Payments
account's balance to a target account. This target account is selected depending
on the reason behind the balance debit.

fields.name: account
fields.description: The payments account of the balance debit.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount and currency of the balance debit.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time the balance debit was created at.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A summary describing the balance debit.

fields.name: failureCode
fields.description: The reason behind a failed balance debit.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description:
Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to a balance debit. This can be useful for storing additional
information about the balance debit in a structured format.

fields.name: processedAt
fields.description: The time the balance debit was processed at.

fields.name: reasonCode
fields.description: The reason behind the balance debit.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of a balance debit.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsBalanceDebitReasonCode
types.description: The reason behind the balance debit.

enumValues.name: CHARGEBACK_PROTECTION
enumValues.description: The balance debit represents a chargeback protection fee.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsBalanceDebitStatus
types.description: The status associated to a balance debit.

enumValues.name: SUCCESS
enumValues.description: The funds were successfully debited from the account.

enumValues.name: FAILURE
enumValues.description: The funds were not able to be debited from the account. See the failure code for more details.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The debit request has been received but not yet processed.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: An error occurred when processing the balance debit.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsBalanceDebitFailureCode
types.description: The reason behind a failed balance debit.

enumValues.name: INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS
enumValues.description: There are insufficient funds in the payments account's balance to satisfy the balance debit amount.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsBalanceDebitReversePayload
types.description: Return type for `shopifyPaymentsBalanceDebitReverse` mutation.

fields.name: debitReversal
fields.description: The object that contains the metadata about the reversal.

fields.name: userErrors
fields.description: List of errors that occurred executing the mutation.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsBalanceDebitReversal
types.description: A balance debit reversal is a partial or full reversal of a debit.

fields.name: account
fields.description: The payments account of the reversal.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount and currency of the reversal.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A summary describing the reason the debit was reversed.

fields.name: failureCode
fields.description: The reason behind a failed balance debit reversal, if it failed or errored out.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Globally unique identifier.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description:
Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to a debit reversal.
This can be useful for storing additional information about the reversal in a structured format.

fields.name: processedAt
fields.description: The date and time the debit reversal was processed at.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of a balance debit reversal.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsBalanceDebitReversalStatus
types.description: The status associated to a balance debit reversal.

enumValues.name: FAILURE
enumValues.description: The debit was not able to be reversed. See the failure code for more details.

enumValues.name: PENDING
enumValues.description: The debit reversal request has been received but not yet processed.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: An error occurred when processing the balance debit reversal.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsBalanceDebitReversalFailureCode
types.description: The reason behind a failed balance debit reversal.

enumValues.name: INSUFFICIENT_FUNDS
enumValues.description: There are insufficient funds in the Shopify Payments platform account's balance to satisfy the reversal amount.

enumValues.name: REVERSAL_AMOUNT_EXCEEDED
enumValues.description: The reversal amount that was requested exceeds the debit's original amount.

inputFields.description: Payout schedule for the account.

inputFields.name: billingDetails
inputFields.description: The billing details for the Shopify Payments account.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsPayoutScheduleInput
types.description: The payment schedule for a Shopify payments account.

inputFields.name: interval
inputFields.description: The interval at which payouts are sent to the connected bank account.

inputFields.name: weeklyAnchor
inputFields.description:
The day of the week funds will be paid out.

The value can be any weekday from Monday to Friday.
If the payment interval is set to weekly, this value will be used.

inputFields.name: monthlyAnchor
inputFields.description:
The day of the month funds will be paid out.

The value can be any day of the month from the 1st to the 31st.
If the payment interval is set to monthly, this value will be used.
Payouts scheduled between 29-31st of the month are sent on the last day of shorter months.

types.name: PayoutSchedulePayoutInterval
types.description: The interval at which payouts are sent to the connected bank account.

enumValues.name: WEEKLY
enumValues.description: Each week, on the day of week specified by weeklyAnchor.

enumValues.name: MONTHLY
enumValues.description: Each month, on the day of month specified by monthlyAnchor.

types.name: ShopifyPaymentsBillingDetailsInput
types.description: The billing details for a Shopify payments account.

inputFields.name: phoneNumber
inputFields.description: The phone number of the legal entity.

inputFields.name: chargeStatementDescriptor
inputFields.description:
Default statement descriptor used for charges (for every country except Japan).
 This is what buyers will see on their credit card or bank statements when making a purchase.

inputFields.name: kanaChargeStatementDescriptor
inputFields.description:
Kana statement descriptor used for charges (for Japan only).
 This is what buyers will see on their credit card or bank statements when making a purchase.

inputFields.name: kanjiChargeStatementDescriptor
inputFields.description:
Kanji statement descriptor used for charges (for Japan only).
 This is what buyers will see on their credit card or bank statements when making a purchase.

inputFields.name: payoutStatementDescriptor
inputFields.description:
Descriptor used for payouts.
This is what merchants will see on their bank statement when receiving a payout.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

Discount code applications capture the intentions of a discount code at
the time that it is applied onto an order.

fields.description: The method by which the discount's value is allocated to its entitled items.

An ordered index that can be used to identify the discount application and indicate the precedence
of the discount application for calculations.

fields.description: How the discount amount is distributed on the discounted lines.

fields.description: Whether the discount is applied on line items or shipping lines.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the discount application.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 2048. This argument is deprecated: Use `maxHeight` on `Image.transformedSrc` instead.

args.name: contentType
args.description: Converts image file type from SVG to PNG, or leaves as original SVG.

fields.name: imageType
fields.description: Semantic type of a Home Card image. These can be used to treat images differently in the UI.

fields.name: layout
fields.description: Specifies a view template to use when rendering the card.

fields.name: message
fields.description: A more detailed description of the card, typically containing the actual messaging to the merchant.

fields.name: showVote
fields.description: Specifies if this card can be voted on.

fields.name: snoozable
fields.description: Specifies if this card can be dismissed temporarily.

fields.name: snoozeMessage
fields.description: A message displayed when the user snoozes the card.

fields.name: snoozeTitle
fields.description: A title displayed when the user snoozes the card.

fields.name: spotlight
fields.description: Specifies if this card can be pulled up into a priority container on top of the feed.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Text for the header of the card.

fields.name: video
fields.description: The YouTube URL of the video.

types.name: ManualDiscountApplication
types.description: Manual discount applications capture the intentions of a discount that was manually created for an order.

fields.name: index

An ordered index that can be used to identify the discount application and indicate the precedence
of the discount application for calculations.

fields.name: targetSelection
fields.description: How the discount amount is distributed on the discounted lines.

fields.name: targetType
fields.description: Whether the discount is applied on line items or shipping lines.

fields.name: value

types.name: ScriptDiscountApplication
types.description:
Script discount applications capture the intentions of a discount that
was created by a Shopify Script for an order's line item or shipping line.

fields.name: index

An ordered index that can be used to identify the discount application and indicate the precedence
of the discount application for calculations.

fields.name: targetSelection
fields.description: How the discount amount is distributed on the discounted lines.

fields.name: targetType
fields.description: Whether the discount is applied on line items or shipping lines.

fields.name: title
fields.description: The title of the application as defined by the Script.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the discount application.
